main event: A radar operator at Arcata Air Force Station in California observed an unidentified aerial object on radar on April 7, 1960.
interesting points: The object was detected on radar at about 15 miles northeast of the station at an altitude of 6,000 feet.
The object was moving in a straight line at a constant speed of approximately 1,000 mph.
The object was also visible to the naked eye and was illuminated with a bright light.
The object suddenly disappeared from the radar scope after about 1 minute of observation.
No unusual atmospheric conditions or meteorological phenomena were evident at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a fast-moving illuminated object detected on radar
